sources.title: Tarzan The Tiger (1929)
sources.description: I've been researching newly public domain films from 1929 and earlier, so I'm uploading the best possible copies that I can find. This once-lost film serial is one of the earliest sound serials that still exists. It has an attached soundtrack and some sound effects, but has no spoken dialogue. Tarzan the Tiger is actually a sequel to the Tarzan the mighty serial series, though that serial is unfortunately considered lost. While reviews are not exactly ecstatic for this serial, it still serves as a fun time capsule for the era.Â  Version Sourced from "Cult Cinema Classics": https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5HdMyBN8vow , https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ACcmRT0lEW8

sources.title: Tarzan the Tiger (1929) Part 2 - Action, Adventure, Silent- Chapters 8 - 15
sources.description:
After Tarzan's estate is destroyed, Jane is sold into slavery by a man posing as a friendly scientist. Tarzan develops amnesia after a blow to the head, and embarks on a journey to recover his memory and save Jane.  

Director: Henry MacRae 
Writers: Edgar Rice Burroughs, Ford Beebe
Stars: Frank Merrill, Natalie Kingston, Al Ferguson 
Genres: Classic, Silent, Action, Adventure

Chapters 8 - 15 of 15 Thrilling Chapters  
00:00 Catchup Part 1 prequel chapters 1-7 here https://youtu.be/5HdMyBN8vow
00:34 Chapter 8- Loop of Death
19:23 Chapter 9- Flight of Werper
37:40 Chapter 10- Prisoner of the Apes
54:54 Chapter 11- The Jaws of Death
1:10:52 Chapter 12- The Jewels of Opar
1:29:41 Chapter 13- A Human Sacrifice
1:44:31 Chapter 14- Tarzan's Rage
2:01:50 Chapter 15- Tarzan's Triumph

metadata.Plot: After Tarzan's estate is destroyed by Arabs Jane is sold into slavery by a man posing as a friendly scientist. Tarzan develops amnesia after a blow to the head. When he recovers his memory (from a later blow) he defeats the villain, recovers the fabulous jewels of Opar, and rescues Jane.
metadata.Actors: Frank Merrill, Natalie Kingston, Al Ferguson
